titles: Catechismus, that is to say, a shorte instruction into Christian religion for the synguler commoditie and profyte of childre[n] and yong people. Set forth by the mooste reuerende father in God Thomas Archbyshop of Canterbury, primate of all England and Metropolitane
author: Cranmer, Thomas, 1489-1556.
Jonas, Justus, 1493-1555.
publisher: In S. Jhones strete by Nycolas Hyll. for] Gwalter Lynne, [dwellyng on Somers kaye by Byllynges gate],
notes: Place of publication and actual printer's name from colophon.

Commonly called "Cranmer's Catechisme", having been translated under his direction from a catechism compiled in Latin by Justus Jonas, the elder, from the elementary instructions in use among the German pastors.--MiU.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
